name: Sheraton Los Angeles Downtown Hotel

reviews.text: I was promised club access by mgmt prior to arrival. ELSIE (mgmt) told me that I was lying and there was no male mgmt working that day. She proceeded to punish me by denying me every request and sticking me on the 7th floor stating there was nothing else available. Cue the manager from the back whom I talked to earlier and promised me. He honored his statements and confirmed my story. Elsie slinks to the back and refused to come out when I asked for her. No apologies for her disgusting attitude and ugly statements. She was BEYOND NASTY! Tearing up my spg card!
reviews.title: Horrible staff!

reviews.text: This was a VERY disappointing experience. Our admin assistant booked the room for me and was quoted a government rate, even though we are not a government agency. She made the reservation over the phone and the government rate was offered by an agent over the phone. Of course she went along with the booking. After working and traveling across the country, I went to check in and was told that I do not have a government ID and could not check in with that rate. I had to pay TRIPLE the cost for every night. I spoke to Jun or June, the night manager, who repeatedly tried to demean by saying, "you have to show your government ID." He kept saying it as if I were an idiot. I explained repeatedly that I did not make the booking and they should honor the rate. Jun gave me an AAA discount. I then decided to cancel the remainder of the reservation and stay only one night. It was VERY unpleasant and I did not appreciate the unprofessional manner in which this was handled. Once checked in, I called the corporate office, but it was already after hours. It was 1 in the morning PST which is 4am EST to my body. They should modify their reservation procedures or educate the agents. There is at least one person out there misrepresenting the brand.
reviews.title: A view from the other hand...

reviews.text: The rate should have been honored. They then could go back to the person that made the reservation and deal with them. However, they just assumed their staff was 100% correct.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel neat and clean. Front desk very helpful. Very good place to stay because of the location. Walked around at night in the dark and it was ok. I would travel with a companion, not by yourself. Very easy to get to the train station which is across the street.
reviews.title: Better Than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're staying in downtown Los Angeles, this is a good place to stay. We didn't do anything downtown, so I'm not sure if there's much to do. The hotel is above a small shopping mall, so there are a few places to eat.
reviews.title: A lot nicer than we expected after reading previous reviews

reviews.text: Stayed here as it was a good location for a convention. There were elevator problems. When we went into our room, we had a dirty towel folded in the bathroom, there was a qtip under the bed. Clearly housekeeping didn't attend to details. This continued through the stay, with bare minimum being done. Received misinformation from the desk. I read previous reviews about the rooms being old and outdated and thought that would be okay. They really are old. I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Not worth the stay

reviews.text: As far as big city hotels go you can feel if you are just another guest or if the hotel is trying hard to impress you and gain your loyalty. Sheraton Downtown did not do either. The lobby area is nothing special actually more notable for its lack of appeal. The restaurant on the lobby floor served up a wonderful juicy and tasty burger with a wonderful waitress of mature years who was very sweet and professional. The room was comfortable as was the bed but the bathroom was a little on the small side compared to other brand city hotels. Housekeeping was ok but nothing to rave about. Front desk staff and concierge were accommodating but one phone operator and a girl serving in the Starbucks were either having bad days or were plain miserable and had big attitude. Most annoying was that this hotel with over 400 rooms had just 4 elevators with 26 floors and for the first two days only 2 were working and we often had to wait 10 - 15 minutes for an elevator to come. On a return visit to LA i would look for another brand hotel.
reviews.title: ok experience with nothing outstanding

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel for a conference at convention center. It was a 1 mile walk. The check in for me was quick, and because I am a Starwood member I got complimentary water in my room, I was told to ignore the $4 sign on it. Upon receiving my bill, I was charged for water one night but it was taken off when I asked. The elevators were an issue. We were always waiting, and waiting, and waiting at prime times for them. We took the service elevators a few times which was ok. The beds were super comfy so I can't complain there. Our window in our room opened. I read a lot of reviews where the windows didn't open. It was nice to have some fresh air. No fan in the bathroom, and not very many towels or washcloths but when I called for extra they were instantly brought up to the room. The air/heat....it was very basic. We didn't need to adjust it at all but it was constantly running. It sounded like someone was taking a shower or something. I'm a "white noise" person so I didn't mind it at all. Bathroom was quite roomy but needs new wallpaper. ALL of the staff I dealt with were kind and professional.
reviews.title: Ok Hotel, Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lots of eating options around the hotel. I really liked Tossed at Wilshire/Hope and The Counter (I believe this was on 7th?) Both had the "build your own" sandwich or salad type thing and both had Vegan options. There is an IHOP a couple blocks away, as well as a UPS Store in case you need to ship anything like I did. The mall connected to the hotel is pretty basic....Macy's, Victoria's Secret, Express, Hallmark, Bath and Body Works. I think there was a shoe store also. The food court in the mall is pretty sad. I didn't eat there.
reviews.title: Ok rooms, lots of problems

reviews.text: Overall, I can't complain about the hotel. It was clean but needs a little updating.
reviews.title: Not Starwood quality but great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were fine and it did remind me a little of Comfort Inn, the price was a little high, the parking was expensive and difficult to get in and out (yes, the ticket did not work for us either at first). We had breakfast at the hotel - wow was it pricey!
reviews.title: Stay here only if you have business downtown

reviews.text: The most annoying part about our stay at the Sheraton was the incorrect information I received at checkin. I was told the price of the parking. When it came time to checkout and pay for that priviledge the next morning, turns out the the price was much higher then I was told. Worse, the 2 people behind the reception desk were very vocal and rude when I mentioned that the person checking me in quoted a different price.
reviews.title: More amenities at a Comfort Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't think I will stay there again. I know there are places in LA that treat their customers with respect. This was not one of them.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: By the way, downtown LA is not a good place to hang out at night. Most of the shops are sealed shut and various interesting characters are walking around.
reviews.title: Good, but I expect more

reviews.text: Maybe I expected too much from a Sheraton room at $200. Scratch the veneer and you can see how old (not in a good way) this hotel really is. The lobby looks great, but head upstairs and you can see the carpet fading....in room decor is fine, bed pretty decent. But there are no in-room safes, so your passport, laptop, Rx's, not secure when you're away. Plastic water cups and paper coffee cups - so low end, so not green, so 'old roadside motel'. Bathroom toiletries also very low end. No in room bar/fridge. No ipod hookup. Elderly yellowed telephone. Bathroom had no heat lamp or fan. Tub old, almost slipped in the shower. So while the decor itself was updated, the amenities were low end and not current. Oh you can hear the guy next door's entire phone conversation. Staff was nice. Room service breakfast was good. But really I have gotten a bigger bang for my buck at a decent motel chain.
reviews.title: After a 5-day stay, I don't get all the negative reviews.

reviews.text: The hotel wifi is virtually non existent in the room, my wifi hot spot barely works in the room, and the ethernet cord for wired access is not accessible from the desk. All of which makes its difficult to work from the room.
reviews.title: Not business friendly

reviews.text: There was no room service menu in the room, and the Wall Street Journl was not available from Room Service.
reviews.title: Easy 12 min walk to LA Live

reviews.text: I have to think the majority of the Hotel's traffic would be business travelers, but they don't seem tuned into to making it easy to work on business at the hotel.
reviews.title: Pretty lackluster

reviews.text: Hotel was as expected for an early 80's building - very confusing lobby layout which must have been the rage during the times. Rooms are standard issue but the bedding is quite comfortable. Hotel lobby bar is dreary yet still demands higher prices. Fitness/Gym facilities are top notch as they give you a pass to the LA Fitness in the adjoining mall - this is a huge improvement over most 'hotel gyms' you can actually get in a complete workout. Ann at the front counter made the stay very pleasant and provided above the rim service. This is not the Ritz but for the savings it's an easy 12 min walk to LA Live.
reviews.title: Central Downtown location

reviews.text: I will preface this by saying that I am used to staying in Joie De Vivres, Ritz Carltons, and boutique hotels, so perhaps I have been spoiled. However, even based on comparable Hyatt and Marriott rooms I have stayed in, I'll say this Sheraton is really dreary. Our room was $340/nt, so I was expecting a certain level of service and quality. Other hotels that are much nicer have similarly priced rooms in the area. Even the Ritz was only $20-40 more than The Sheraton, and The Standard was less. The Sheraton's newly renovated rooms are in serious need of a renovation. The rooms are dark with orange-based taupes and dark wood furniture which lend to a somewhat depressing ambiance. The bathrooms are also horribly outdated, and the wallpaper made us a little dizzy. I will say, however, that the water pressure in the shower was hands down, the best water pressure I have ever had in a hotel. So good job on that, Sheraton! The bed was also very squeaky, so I woke up a few times when I moved. Probably depends on what room you are in.
reviews.title: Good, but not fantastic

reviews.text: Stayed here with my father and two brothers. We came down to see the Dodgers and this seemed to be close to Dodger Stadium. Nice Hotel, attached to a Mall that I never went to. Parking can be pricey, but there are some cheaper options nearby to keep those costs in check.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel... but nothing happening around here in the evening...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As it says, this hotel is located in downtown Los Angeles. I assumed there would be a million things to do around here... After the Dodger game on a Tuesday night my brother and I went for a walk to find a place to get a beer or something. It was like a ghost town. I am sure there was a lot of cool stuff going on somewhere in L.A. but it certainly wasn't anywhere near this Hotel!
reviews.title: Quality hotel and convenient to Staples Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That said, the hotel was clean, the staff was great, and I have nothing negative to say about this place.
reviews.title: Overall great stay thanks to a recent renovation and an upgrade

reviews.text: Top of the line for the Sheraton brand. Business atmosphere, but rooms are spacious and upgraded. Not much in the way of views, but it's LA, so not a priority. The best part is the location with 10 min to Staples Center and LA Live dining area, it's ideal. Easy and hassle-free stay. Expect to pay $32 for valet parking overnight.
reviews.title: Good luck

reviews.text: SUMMARY: Large hotel with a great downtown location and convenient access to Macy's Plaza and the adjacent shopping mall. Recent renovation made it a clean and comfortable stay with good service (for the most part).
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: I was very impressed by our Stay at the Sheraton Downtown.
reviews.title: Best of Downtown LA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When Air Canada screwed up our flights, I phone the Sheraton and they cancelled our first night's reservation even though technically they did not have to. When our hot water was not working, they gave us buffet breakfast. - free. They gave us a cot for our room -free. They upgraded us to one of the best rooms in the hotel - free. They went out of their way to give us a great stay.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with expensiv parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean rooms, friendly staff, great location - close to conference center, great conference rate. I only wish they had had a swimming pool too. No big deal.
reviews.title: Beware the inadequate air conditioning system!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will be here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful facility but poor service and incompetent staff

reviews.text: We stayed there for couple of days in remodeled rooms. Room was clean and nice. We had nothing to complain about the service or hotel itself. They always had fresh fruit in the gym and orange water in the reception.
reviews.title: They take care of their SPG Customers! ~ A+

reviews.text: The Sheraton downtown Los Angeles is as eventful and exciting as PBS daytime broadcasting. Straight vanilla.
reviews.title: Middle of the road

reviews.text: Check-in was good very standard, nice man at the front, I believe it was Juan, did a wonderful job checking us in.
reviews.title: Nice downtown location, rude bellman, stolen license plate

reviews.text: But started to go downhill after that, first no mini bar in the room was very odd. The rooms need a serious LA facelift, very old looking and dingy. Ordered in room dining, and it took 45 minutes for a awful club sandwich. The valet is a side show, separate valets for "oversized vehicles" and the choice to pay there or walk back up to the front desk to have the bill added to your folio, (for business travelers its just a hassle).
reviews.title: Not worth it

reviews.text: Their were some good and some bad but overall it's just PLAIN!
reviews.title: good downtown hotel

reviews.text: We had a 4 night stay at the Sheraton. Upon check-in, the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. However, the bellman was very rude, telling us he "didn't have anything to do with" the white paper I asked about - which was the parking pass to exit the deck. Each time we asked him questions, he snapped at us. When he loaded our bags for bell service, he was rude. My friend let him know that he was being rude and he said he thought he was being helpful. We chose to do valet parking and asked him if he needed our license plate number and he said no. So we handed over the vehicle key and headed to our room. He also failed to tell us to contact the front desk with our bell number so they will bring our bags up.
reviews.title: Totally satisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a frequent business traveller and generally stay in Starwood hotels when possible such as W, Sheraton, Westin... As a result I was "upgraded" to a larger, fancier room when my wife and I checked in to the downtown Sheraton for a night. The view from the 19th floor was nice but if these are the fancy rooms I'd hate to see what the average ones are like. As others have noted, heating and cooling is basically an on-off switch, no thermostat. The heating unit was a huge, ugly box hanging down from the ceiling right over our bed. Bedding was perfectly fine and the bed was comfy. But there were a couple mystifying things that simply didn't make sense. #1, no towel bar in the bathroom so no hand towel by the sink. Really, you can't bolt in some nice towel bars so guests don't have to grope around for a hand towel that is up in the top of the shower? #2, at check-in the front desk had only 1 person working at 8PM on a Friday night. I didn't really expect to wait 10 minutes just to get my room. #3. At check in the desk clerk make a big point to mention that because of my SPG Gold Status we would receive complimentary bottled water along with our room upgrade. But there was no bottled water in the room we got, just tacky plastic cups for tap water. Not a huge deal but why go out of your way to mention a benefit and then not deliver?
reviews.title: Needs a Substantial Overhaul

reviews.text: And, as other mentioned, the layout of the hotel is totally wacky. You go in the front door at ground level and then descend a long escalator at least 2 stories down into the lobby. Perhaps it was designed as a fallout shelter? I don't know. But very odd.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.text: In the last year I've stayed in Sheratons in Sacramento, La Jolla, Sunnyvale, San Jose and Los Angeles. The other four were all terrific but this one is not up to the standards of the brand. I don't know if hotels are franchises or all owned by the corporation. If it's a franchise they really need to whip this one into shape.
reviews.title: VERY Old Building, Ancient A/C & Heat System, Lousy Internet

reviews.text: The best thing about the hotel is its location. This part of 7th Street has really come alive in recent years. Great restaurants, close to museums and Staples Center... Eat at Bottega Louie across the street for breakfast if you get the chance. The late night front desk clerk was also really helpful making suggestions of some cool bars and things for us to explore. I appreciated that.
reviews.title: Good downtown location, spacious rooms

reviews.text: This was just okay - our 3G and 4G service didn't work in our rooms, and the wireless was free only in the lobby. TV remote or programming was terrible, couldn't just browse channels. Bathrooms need upgrades. It just doesn't rise to 3 "dots" - maybe 2.5. Location was really good. Limited food options in the hotel/mall but many nearby. They say guests can use the "attached" gym but that's not true. We were sent to the Gold's Gym two blocks away.
reviews.title: Excellent representative for the brand

reviews.text: - No water in the vending machine- 9th floor
reviews.title: All you complainers - stay away! Great place for non-tighties.

reviews.text: - Rudely awakened by the maids in the morning (around 8.00AM)- they were cleaning the room across from us and talking really loud.
reviews.title: A business hotel

reviews.text: We stopped here as a hotel that is close to USC for a college visit. College was about 10 minutes away by car. Check in was quick and easy. We did self park, so got the parking ticket from check in and ran out to drive up area and my husband drove into the parking garage attached to hotel. What a crazy ride! It goes in deep turns until you reach about the 4th level. Dizzy for myself and son as the passengers, but my husband is a race car driver, so he loved every turn! The room itself was clean. Beds were comfortable. We went out for a bite to eat and found many bums in the area outside of the hotel. We did a quick pretzel stop and went back to our room to eat. We didn't feel safe to stay out any longer than necessary. There is a mall right in the hotel plaza, but they closed by the time we got checked in and went downstairs.
reviews.title: Parking Garage Gone Wild, Nice Hotel,

reviews.text: Great location. We stayed here for two nights. Attended a Staples Centre event and walked back and forth. Lots to do around Hotel. We visited Anaheim and other great California locations. Rooms comfortable. Internet was refunded. Valet parking was only $4 more per night then mall parking garge.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sheraton LA Downtown in March, 2013. There is a mall connected to the hotel, however, this is not really a mall. There is a Macy's which I didn't go to, but there really weren't any other stores. There is no food court and the only place to eat was in the hotel restaurant. The restaurant was average and the service was good. The room was a good size, bathroom was clean and well appointed. My biggest disappointment was the "mall" and the location. I would not feel safe venturing out at night.
reviews.title: Hotel is okay, location is questionable.

reviews.text: A friend and I stayed in this hotel because of its proximity to the jewelry and garment district. It coast us a whopping $28 to self-park the car at the hotel. Ouch! And, as usual with Starwood properties, internet was not free. No refrigerator. No microwave. My overall perception of this room was that many things in the room were worn-looking. For example, some of the caulking in the bathroom needed replacement and the ceiling need to be repainted. The controls for the air conditioner were incredibly outdated. To make the room more "warm" or "cool" I slid a lever from left to right. No digital thermostat here.... I had to guess how far to move the lever. On the up-side, the bedding was clean and the mattresses were very comfortable. The bathroom was free of mold and the drains worked well. When we booked the room the only option was a king sized bed for my friend and I, but upon arrival the friendly attendant at the front desk was able to change it to a room with 2 doubles. There was Starbucks coffee and tea in the room. Under the work desk there was a power strip where we could plug in multiple things, like phone chargers. That was really nice. Another comment is that our room was next to the elevator, but we didn't hear any noise. The whole floor was very quiet. We were on the 18th floor, which required a short wait for the elevator. I've never stayed in downtown L.A., so I don't know how this hotel compares to others in the area. I wouldn't mind staying here again if I got a great deal. If not, I'd rather try another property.
reviews.title: Needs Some Updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from the LA marathon, having stayed at the Sheraton Downtown because it was one of the hotels secured for the marathon. The rate that was given was definitely not the posted rate, because of that I would consider the hotel a reasonable value for cost. I particularly liked the fact that the parking was not ridiculously expensive. The charge was 12 per night extra. I had stayed at the Westin Bonaventure in September and they were charging around 30 per night. The front staff was pleasant. The rooms were clean, however, somewhat dated. The HAV was located above the beds which was a little odd. The fear that something would fall on your head(which would not happen for real) made it not so comfortable. The rooms were clean and fresh but the small details were off. The outlets were all from the 1970's. They had yellowed with time and the HAV control seemed to come from the same era. The bathroom was normal in size, tub was the old ceramiccoated steel, tiles were relatively new. Fixtures were of a standard grade. Overall the room was very comfortable, but nothing that would warrant anything memorable. I would stay there again if the price was good but otherwise might try something else new to see what is available in the downtown area. There seems to be a lot of small hotels spread all over that might be worth a try.
reviews.title: A little dated, depending on cost might not be the best value

The Sheraton Downtown LA is relatively close to the staples center (about 7-8 blocks away) and I felt safe walking there and back, even late at night after the concert got out. We pulled up to valet, and saw no one around to help us, so we got out of the car and asked someone where to park. We Self parked ($28/day), and yes the circle thing you drive up to get to the parking garage is crazy but fun. You have to walk thru a run down mall (where I got approached by homeless for money) to get to Sheraton. Once you get the the Sheraton its very nice, the Lobby is awesome.
reviews.title: Dated but good location
